PokÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©mon Battle Revolution begins when you enter the PokÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©topia: a theme park made from 10 different specially designed Colosseum PokÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©mon battles. Explore PokÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©topia to customize the look of your coach, unlock secrets and watch your favorite PokÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©mon fight in spectacular style against opponents from around the world!
In the single player mode you can face PokÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©topia coaches, advance to face tough opponents and unlock secret content. Some of the secrets can be transferred to PokÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©mon Diamond or PokÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©mon Pearl. And if you do not have PokÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©mon Diamond or PokÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©mon Pearl, you can also fight PokÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©topia hire a pass at the front door! Hire a pass gives you a random selection of six PokÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©mon to get you started and lets you save your game progress.
In multiplayer mode, there are many options. In Free Battle, PokÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©topia friends with passes may face rent, and DS Battle mode allows up to four people connect their DS to a Wii and import their Pokemon for battle. In DS Battle is possible to control the action on TV from the DS touch screen. So, if you enable this option, the command will not appear on the screen, and you can enjoy the battles in all their glory!
Finally there is the option to play online with Wi-Fi Connection Nintendo against coaches from around the world. You can play against coaches selected randomly, or using Friend Codes to face those who are on your friends list. You can point to 60 friends on your list, so there is always someone to fight!
The controls are easy as could be. Apart from being able to use a Nintendo DS to control the game on the DS vs. DS, you have the option to navigate through menus by pointing to the screen with the Wii remote and select with the cursor, or hold the Wii Remote sideways and move from option to option with the + Control Pad.

You've never seen it like your favorite PokÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©mon and watch them fight in Wii is undoubtedly a revolution.
